title: entrypoint.sh use line ending with CRLF
body:
I tried to execute the docker but the backend container failed with:
`
2025-02-08 23:23:42 Waiting for MySQL...
2025-02-08 23:23:42 ./entrypoint.sh: line 2: $'\r': command not found
2025-02-08 23:23:42 ./entrypoint.sh: line 18: syntax error: unexpected end of file
`

I tried to update the file end line sequence from CRLF TO LF then issue gone, not sure I'm the only one met this issue or not.
author: ee07b415

comments.body:
Adding some more context.

When I try to execute the docker after clone the repo, I run into the entrypoint.sh not found first, I thought it may related to the docker entrypoint issue, so I update the script to bash and adding the bash executing on the script, then this end line issue show up.

Thank you for reporting this issue! I've added a `.gitattributes` file to resolve the line ending issues across different platforms.

### Why did this happen?
This issue occurs because different operating systems use different line endings:
- Windows uses CRLF (\r\n)
- Unix/Linux/macOS uses LF (\n)

When Windows users clone the repository, Git might automatically convert files to CRLF format. When these files are then run in Docker (Linux environment), it causes the `$'\r': command not found` error you encountered.

### Solution
I've added a `.gitattributes` file to consistently manage line endings for all files:
```text
# Set default behavior to automatically normalize line endings
* text=auto

# Unix/Linux/macOS style files (using LF)
*.sh text eol=lf
*.bash text eol=lf
Dockerfile text eol=lf
.dockerignore text eol=lf
docker-compose*.yml text eol=lf
*.py text eol=lf
*.json text eol=lf
*.yml text eol=lf
*.yaml text eol=lf
*.md text eol=lf

# Windows style files (using CRLF)
*.{cmd,[cC][mM][dD]} text eol=crlf
*.{bat,[bB][aA][tT]} text eol=crlf
*.ps1 text eol=crlf

# Binary files (no conversion)
*.png binary
*.jpg binary
*.gif binary
*.ico binary
*.zip binary
*.pdf binary
```

This configuration ensures:
1. Shell scripts and Docker-related files always use LF endings
2. Windows-specific files maintain CRLF endings
3. Binary files remain untouched

Now the project should work consistently across all platforms without manual intervention. Please pull the latest changes and try again. Let me know if you encounter any other issues!

title: Optimize code and add logging
body:
Add logging and docstrings to various functions and optimize database queries.

* **Logging**:
  - Add logging for key creation, update, and deletion in `backend/app/api/api_v1/api_keys.py`.
  - Add logging for knowledge base creation, update, and deletion in `backend/app/api/api_v1/knowledge_base.py`.
  - Add logging for MinIO operations in `backend/app/core/minio.py`.

* **Docstrings**:
  - Add docstrings to all functions in `backend/app/api/api_v1/api_keys.py`.
  - Add docstrings to all functions in `backend/app/api/api_v1/knowledge_base.py`.
  - Add docstrings to all functions in `backend/app/core/minio.py`.

* **Configuration**:
  - Add comments to explain each configuration setting in `backend/app/core/config.py`.
  - Ensure all environment variables are properly loaded in `backend/app/core/config.py`.

* **Optimization**:
  - Optimize database queries for key retrieval in `backend/app/api/api_v1/api_keys.py`.
  - Optimize database queries for knowledge base retrieval in `backend/app/api/api_v1/knowledge_base.py`.
